subtitles.dialogue_text: you can tell what time of year it is
by which flowers are in bloom.
In Yokohama it's which boats you see
Only there are more and more them now
we have a great view of the boats from my house on Poppy Hill.
and my mother studying in America,
and do laundry for our borders.
is eager to get rid of the old
and make way for the new.
but some of us aren't so ready
to let go of the past.
And sometimes the past is not ready to let go of us either.
So, late night at the hospital again Miki?
If you like, I can save dinner for you?
What would we do without Umi?
- What would I do without... - Hay sis, I got another hole in my sock!
Just leave it beside the sewing machine.
That boy has holes in his head?
Well I've got sports today: So, pack a big lunch.
Is there a hole in your stomach too?
- Here Riku, have my egg. - Yes! Thank you.
You should take it Miki. You need it more than him.
Now, which one of you is the doctor?
At least someone cares about my hunger pains.
Hay! Easy on the soy sauce.
But I like it this way.
- Good morning, Grand Hana. - Good morning, Hana.
Riku, why don't you and Umi share your mother's plate.
Grandmother, would you like me to make you some tea?
Yes Umi, that would be lovely.
I bid you all good morning.
I couldn't get my hair to look right.
It looks like hair is supposed to look.
- I don't know how you keep up... - Can I have your dinner?
Do you want a ride Umi?
- No thank you, I'll walk. - Ah, to be young.
Τomoko could you finish the laundry for me?
Of course. I'd be happy to.
Umi, over here. Come see this.
Oh, just an article about you.
It must be about you. Who else raises flags every morning?
"Fair girl, why do you send your thoughts to the sky?"
"the wind carries them aloft to mingle with the crows."
"trimmed with blue, your flags fly again today."
Oh! Looks like someone's getting your messages.
I doubt it. Someone at this school.
Getting those messages just doesn't calculate.
He's one of those snobby guys that live in that dirty old clubhouse.
- Thanks for waiting. - Curry udon again?
Oh and you're one to talk.
Let me guess. Tuna sandwiches again.
Umi, your lunches always look so good.
You should try making your own sometime.
One two, one two, one two, one two, one two.
Save our building! [LATIN QUARTER ANTI-DEMOLITION LEAGUE]
Smile for the camera love birds.
The mackerel was on sale today.
I almost forgot, I have a meeting with Grandmother.
Very impressive. You're managing the house beautifully.
Only because your paying Τomoko's wages,
I would have hired her anyway even if we hadn't taken in boarders.
Tell me my child, is this too much work for you?
But why? I promise I'm not letting it get in the way of my studies.
believe me I know how much you miss your father.
But it makes me sad watching you every morning raising those flags.
then maybe you won't need to raise those flags anymore.
- I'm sorry to interrupt. - Come in.
I'm finished for the day ma'am.
In fact it created such a stir
some of the girls are talking about starting a fan club.
Shun Kazama. He is a real live wire.
"Fair girl, why do you send your thoughts to the sky?"
thus the principality of Wallachia was hemmed in
by the Ottoman, Turks and Russia, and its territory was coveted by both.
Wow, that's a waste of money.
I don't care what you say.
I think he's cute and I want to get his autograph.
Please come with me to the Latin Quarter Clubhouse.
So that way when I meet him he doesn't think I'm weird.
Are you crazy? I don't want to go to that old place.
- But I'm desperate. - Well I'm not.
but you'll do it for me, won't you?
Wow, they really like signs. [DON'T DEMOLISH OUR CLUBHOUSE]
I've never seen them so distinct!
This might be more awesome than the solar flares of 1960.
I'm sorry to interrupt but we're looking for the school newspaper office.
Third floor, same room as the archeology club.
Well, I love what they've done with the place.
Excuse me where's the archeology club?
Upstairs. Listen for the sound of smug portentousness.
Inquiring minds seeking answers to life's great mysteries.
I will personally offer you my stewardship
and share with you my passion for the philosophical arts.
That's a very kind offer but we're actually headed for the archeology club.
Fine as you wish but when you find yourself seeking the meaning of life.
I'll be right here to enlighten you.
Chemistry club you ruined our contemplation.
Oh well, you're welcome ladies. That guy will talk to you ear off.
Hey that's enough. Show some respect you second grade alchemist.
Here's a thought try experimenting with something that actually exist.
from the clouds, from the light, from the storms
and suggest to man in the universe the shapes they are to take.
Copernicus of the new age, set this galaxy free from the oppressive.
We're high school student from Japan.
Or the challenges of the new...
Hey, couple of potential groupies here to see you.
Or maybe you're the two who actually read that failed weekly rag we publish.
Knock it off Mizunuma. Bring them in and close the
The crux of the matter is.
How can we make archeology cool again.
- Can you please give me your autograph? - Huh?
Thank you, thank you so much.
This? This isn't from the fall. I cut myself shaving.
Hey, how would you like to help Mr. Whiskers here cut some stencils.
Cuz' we're pretty busy with the campaign
keeping Latin Quarters from getting demolished.
But, if you need help with stencils Umi has better handwriting.
What are you talking about Sora?
Look, if you're a second year student,
Look, if you're a second year student, [PHYSICS MIDTERM FORECAST!]
And your teacher is old man Suzuki.
Mizunuma's uses these old tests to make up a mock test for the upcoming physics exam.
That's right. But its not really cheating if you're only half accurate.
Miss. Sora please come with me.
With your permission. I will escort you to the door
lest you be ambushed by our resident philosopher.
- From here to the end. - Uh-huh.
And I say we are cool!
We have to get people interested in the paleolithic period.
Oh you might want to join us Umi,
if you like a room full of guys screaming at each other.
I'm sorry I have to go!
It's ok, you were a big help.
All club members to the first floor!
And I still need to cut some vegetables. Can you help me out?
[Sukiyaki (Ue o muite arukou) - Kyu Sakamoto ] [Billboard hot 100 - June 1963]
Your running a bit late Umi.
Riku, were all out of pork,
and I need you to run
down to the butcher shop and get some. ♪ Ue wo muite arukou ♪
And this is my favorite part.
But didn't Τomoko buy you some?
I used it all for the lunches.
Start the rice in 10 minutes, okay?
Hop on. I'll give you a ride to the bottom of the hill.
Don't worry about this. I can brake just fine with three fingers.
I thought you were at your meeting?
Yeah I was, but I left.
I gotta get back home before my curfew.
And do it before school starts.
Shun, do you mind if I ask you a question?
About the poem in the paper...
I need some sliced pork please.
You won't make it on an empty stomach.
You'd better go ahead without me.
Bah! The colors are wrong when I paint at night.
That's a boat I often see passing by.
This might sound crazy but I think it's answering your flags.
Oh yeah, you can't see it from the garden.
All printed up. Would you like to see your handy work?
There was something printed in the paper I wanted to ask you about?
Um, now might not be the best time, maybe just after school?
Yeah, I was going to ask you to do some more stencils so
maybe we can meet at the club house?
It'll have to be tomorrow though because theirs a big debate today.
- Do you wanna' come? - I'd love to.
But I have too much I have to get done.
It was canceled because of that stupid debate.
I can't go, Τomoko's off today and I really should get home early.
This way for the historic debate. Future of the Latin Quarter to be decided.
[RESOLVED THE LATIN QUARTER SHOULD BE PRESERVED!]
Umi. You heading home? At least I got you a really nice flounder.
Hay is your mom back from America?
I'll come back for the fish later!
Stuck a new state of the arts student center in it's place!
We've suffered the scars of war
and have emerged a stronger people.
A Tokyo where we can showcase our new democracy.
We can not stand in the way of progress.
The Tokyo exhibition will showcase our democracy
as a prime leader in democracy...
We still cling to the past.
It is time we throw these old buildings out
as relics of a bygone era.
want the Latin Quarter torn down.
You're ideas of democracy make me laugh.
We've come here to debate, you already made up our minds for us.
Sit back down or I'll have you thrown out!
Your just like the old men who run this country.
If you're so hell-bent on demolition, demolish your shortsighted thinking!...
You cannot move into the future without first knowing the past!
Destroy everything old and you dishonor those who lived and died before us.
The Olympics has the whole country
thinking all that glitters is gold.
And just because the majority disagrees
doesn't mean were going down without a fight!
♪ I still remember that day long ago. ♪
♫ You looked away, but I saw you crying for me. ♫
♫ When morning came you left an ivory flower. ♫
♫ I walk alone still hoping to find you. ♫
♫ The flower that blooms inside of my heart. ♫
♪ I walk alone still hoping to find you. ♪
♪ The flower that blooms inside of my heart. ♪
I think it was amazing. You're all so passionate.
Yeah, debates are always like that.
I hate that everyone thinks the clubhouse is just an eyesore.
They don't care what's going on inside.
[When I was first in love] [Teshima Aoi]
Hey, I know. Why don't you all just clean the place up?
It's a great old building but no one can see through the dust.
So clean it up. Make it look like new again. Make it cool. Maybe invite a few girls.
Then the boys will like it too.
I would just have to convince everyone
that dust isn't an important part of its history.
The physics midterm mock test was a huge success.
I think it won you guys more then a few admirers.
Here are the stencils. Thanks again.
There was such a big fight
and we were going to be in so much trouble but
Mizunuma got them all to start singing
and the teachers were totally fooled.
When I was there that stuff happened all the time.
Your president Mizunuma is the little brother of a classmate of mine.
Was his brother also a genius?
Here ya' go doctor, from my secret stash.
As a matter of fact, it is.
- Can I have some? - Sora, your too young.
Hay, how about we invite some of the guys from school to my going away party?
Hay, I didn't know you could read signal flags?
and start a practice right here.
Would that mean we'd all have to move out?
You'll probably be married by then.
Oh, if only that were true.
I'm going to marry a man who's brilliant but sensitive.
We can't let them tear the place down.
We need to go over their heads.
To who, the principal just does what the board tells him.
We all just need to be really smart about this.
We need one fast before its too late.
We keep running out of glasses.
This building was built at the turn of the century.
It actually used to be a hospital.
It's over a hundred years old.
Compared to the clubhouse, this all looks practically brand new.
And I'm guessing your part of the reason why.
So your Grandfather was a doctor.
Was your dad a doctor too?
Uh-uh. He was the captain of a ship.
♫ From this valley they say you are going. ♫
♫ We will miss your bright eyes and your smile. ♫
♫ Far from us you are taking the sunshine. ♫
So your mom married a sailor.
My Grandpa and Grand, they didn't approve of the marriage
and so they tried to stop it from happening.
But my mom wouldn't let anything stand in the way of true love.
See defied her parents and marred him anyway?
And your dad, he taught you how to use the signal flags?
Yeah he did. When I was just a girl.
He said they helped him find his way back to us.
So I raised them every day.
That was at our old house.
I raise them from the balcony until his ship docked again.
Then, we got news about his ship.
That it sank during the Korean war.
They never found him and that was that.
But I kept raising the flags
hoping they might help him find me.
And when we moved here, I was so upset I couldn't stop crying.
There was nowhere to raise the flags.
So Grandpa built me that flagpole.
We could use a little light.
Grandmother said, this used to be my Grandfather's office.
But now it's sorta' becomes my mom's private study.
That's from around the time they got married.
Now this is the photo I really love.
That's my dad name. My mom kept the name Matsuzaki.
Umi, come on, your gonna miss Miki's speech.
Ok, coming. We better get back.
When your late your mother worries.
Shun, would you like some dinner?
Nagashima swings! And he misses. Nagashima strikes out.
Now this is the photo I really love.
Now this is the photo I really love. Onodera Sawamura Τachibana
They never found him. Onodera Sawamura Τachibana
We members of the Latin Quarter welcome, all volunteers.
And for offering to help us to restore
and preserve this treasured and magnificent cultural landmark,
Fellow club members, are you ready to fight for what you cherish?
1st year math... 2nd year math... Wow, these are really old exams.
We use all these for the mock test we print.
Whoa! This is Miki's math final. She got a perfect score.
Yamazaki, take over for me will you?
Mizunuma said to toss anything we don't need.
Didn't you guys ever clean this place?
Nope, and neither did the guys before us.
I think tomorrow we better bring the badminton team.
Sora, its time to go home now.
I'm just gonna stay a little while longer.
So what's going on between you and Umi?
Father, there something I would like to ask you.
I have to concentrate so make it short.
Υuichiro Sawamura, is the man in this photo and he's my real father right?
We've already discussed all of this.
You're my son and that's that.
We didn't know what to think the night he brought you.
We had recently lost a child of our own and were struggling through a difficult time.
Sawamura came to our door with you in his arms
and a copy of his family register in his pocket.
The war had taken its toll.
He was going off to sea and his wife was unable to care for you.
your mother had you in her arms, nursing you.
In the Korean war he was on the supply ship that sank and all of the men died.
He sent money and asked about you often.
You remind me of him more and more everyday.
But you will always be our son.
Sachiko do you see it? Is there any answer?
I guess its not coming by today.
We all have to move on don't we.
I wish I could see you off.
It's ok, I know you have to get to school.
I'll drop by now and then. Now, go, before I start crying.
I hope everything works out with you and Shun.
Extra extra extra. Latin Quarter gets a face lift.
Thanks very much. Here you go.
Extra edition of the Latin Quarter Weekly.
Latin Quarter gets a face lift.
We'll need your help today. Thanks.
- Extra, extra! - Extra edition Latin Quarter Weekly.
- I'll be there again today. - Great, still lots to do.
Hi Shun, how's it all going?
I'll see you there later, all right?
Extra, extra extra! Get your Latin Quarter Weekly. Extra.
Extra, extra. Read all about it.
Ok, I'm confused. Why are you mad at me?
Υuichiro Sawamura, is my real father.
I didn't want to believe it either. But I checked with city hall and it's true.
So what do we do now?
I guess, we stopped feeling how we feel.
We'll just have to go back to being friends.
Hey, Sora, did something happen to Umi at school today?
I don't think so. At least not that I'm aware of.
Umi's never made a bad meal that I can remember.
It's me Umi, the bath's ready.
Good morning, Umi. Did you sleep well?
Mom? Your home. When did you get back?
Don't be silly. You know I've been here all along.
Your flags led me home Umi.
You're such a big girl now.
As Latin Quarter alumni, we are more than happy to help.
And if you need more supplies, Jiro here is in construction.
So just give him a call.
No? Why not? You told me business was booming didn't you?
Goodbye and good luck to ya'.
- Thank you very much. - Thank you very much.
Good thing we went to Miki's party.
That Umi comes through for us again.
She must be our goddess of good luck.
Wow, this looks like a real construction site.
- You call that plastering? - Well ah…
Give me that trowel and let me show you how it's done.
First you have to swirl it into a smooth paste to get all the lumps out.
Yeah, they don't call my dad the plaster king for nothing.
The wall, I was talking to the wall.
Sorry you had to stay late.
I hope you won't be in trouble.
Sora actually agreed to cover for me.
Anything you need help with Shun.
So, is that all you need from me?
Yup', that's all I can think of. At least for now.
So, everything cool between you two?
Read about the new building, then see for yourself.
Hot off the press. Majority of girls oppose demolition!
Read about it in the Latin Quarter Weekly.
another victory for Latin Quarter Mock Test.
More mock test in this week's Latin Quarter Weekly.
New poll results give new life to old building.
Majority of all students opposed demolition.
Shun, we're holding an emergency meeting.
The board just voted to tear down the Latin Quarter over the summer break!
I did, I tried reasoning with them. Believe me.
But the principle says, it's out of his hands.
What about all our hard work!
They decided without even looking at it?
The massive ego's wouldn't fit through the doors.
Why don't we just take it straight to the chairman.
The chairman's running a huge company in Tokyo.
We'll never get to see him.
Let's go to Tokyo and make our case.
Only, if our goddess of good luck joins us.
We're very happy you're coming with us.
Me too. It'll help take my mind off... other... things.
No sir. We're appealing directly to Mr. Tokumaru.
Nope. No, they don't seem like radicals.
Take the elevator at the end of the hall to the fourth floor
and his office will be on the right.
Thank you very much for your help.
Don't forget to sign in. And next time make an appointment.
Are you those students from Konan?
Mr. Tokumaru is a very busy man.
He doesn't normally see people who haven't made an appointment.
we didn't actually believe we would get an appointment if we called to make one.
You can wait on the bench as long as you don't disturb anyone.
We thank you for your time ma'am. We thank you for your time ma'am.
I wanna hear Nagashima's heavy. He could win another MVP.
- Let's go get a drink. - Quick before he makes us stay.
Your still here? Well, come on in.
- Ah yes. Right. - Thank you for seeing us.
I'll be with you gentlemen in a minute.
Alright I've made my decision. I can't agree to that right now.
Why are you kids here today and not in school?
Escaped huh. I did that a lot myself.
Well I guess you're here to talk to me about that old clubhouse.
Yes, we've come to you directly to ask you to see the building for yourself.
We've put a lot of work into it.
Come see what we've done that all were asking.
What year are you young lady?
Second year. My name is Umi Matsuzaki.
Sir, that building is more than just a building.
And tell me, how is it "more than just a building?"
And it makes us feel connected to our past.
May I ask what your father did?
He was a captain... on a supply ship..
But his ship sank during the Korean war.
It made a delivery and were coming home.
But his ship hit a mine.
I know it must've been very hard for your mother, raising you on her own.
She obviously did a fine job.
Now, I'll be there tomorrow afternoon.
I'll handle everything with your principal, the rest will be your job.
I actually didn't think that would work.
Yeah, I'm not sure it has.
I promised my mom I'd go visit my uncle. See you tomorrow.
What do you think you'll do, you know after graduation?
Mmm, well, we don't have much money so probably National University.
What will happen to The Weekly?
I'll have to find somebody dedicated enough to take over.
I'm sort of thinking I might like to be a doctor.
Are you the one who wrote that poem in the paper?
I saw those flags every morning from my dad's tugboat,
and I found out it was you.
Well, I can't really see any of the boats from the garden.
So that's why, I never noticed there was somebody out there answering me.
There a message to my father that's says, "I pray for your safe return."
But he knows he can never come back to me.
So what I think he did was send you instead.
And I don't really know what to do because we're...
Look I know we can't do anything about it but just know
Umi, it's good to be back.
Tell me about America and your study's?
Oh, I learned something new every day.
But mostly how much I missed home.
- This is the best thing I ever ate! - Uh-huh.
What's wrong? Why are you awake?
There's something I need to talk to you about.
It must be the time change.
I can't sleep, so I thought I'd organize these books I got in America.
There's this boy at school his name is Shun Kazama.
I'm so confused because he came here for Miki's party
and I showed him the photograph of dad
and he had the exact same photo.
And he said his father and my father were one in the same.
Well, I knew the day would come when I would have to explain this to you.
I told you the story about how your father and I eloped. Didn't I?
And you remember where we used to live?
with the balcony off the living room.
We were newly married and I was pregnant with you.
And your dad was away at sea a lot,
and I was working on my degree studying very hard.
I was determined to do well in school, in case something happened.
When your father returned home that night with a baby.
He's Τachibana's. We need to take him.
Τachibana was killed in an accident aboard a repatriation ship.
His poor wife died from complications during childbirth.
The rest of his family was killed at Nagasaki.
I won't have this child sent to an orphanage.
Your father had legally adopted a newborn baby without even asking me.
The war had just ended. And things like this was were happening everywhere.
Still, there was just no way I could give the child the love and care it deserved.
One of Υuichiro's friend recently lost a child, so we gave the baby to him.
How is he? Tell me, is he doing well?
Your father was impulsive but he always did what he thought was right.
It was a relief to see the baby end up with a loving family.
Are you absolutely sure that Shun couldn't possibly be dads real son?
I don't think I ever considered it.
Don't tell me he actually looks like your father.
- See you tonight. - Yeah mom, see you tonight.
Hello again Mr. Chairman and welcome.
Never knew this existed underneath all that dust.
Oh yes sir, they've done a good job.
And what is your club studying young man?
Sir! The astronomy club has been studying sunspots for the last 10 years. Sir!
Tell me, what discoveries have you made?
That the sun is very very old and our life span is very very short.
Seems to me you could really benefit from a brand new clubhouse.
Something nice for your junior members?
We as human beings have complicated every simple gift of the gods.
I must say principle these students of yours are very very impressive.
I'm gonna take a little look inside.
And what's that dog doing in there?
The third man in that photo is here at the harbor.
I know he can tell you about your father.
But his ship is leaving at… four o'clock.
And he'll be away for several months. Get here!
♪ If the world should sink beneath the sea. ♪
♪ Reach out your hand and find a friend in need. ♪
♫ Brave the storm with head held high ♫
♫ then there is nothing that will make us a yield. ♫
♫ If the world should sink beneath the sea ♫
♫ reach out your hand and find a friend in need. ♫
♫ Brave the storm with head held high ♫
Students, while I am very impressed with your dedication,
it doesn't change the fact, that a new building is needed.
So I guess that makes it my job to find a different place to put it.
None of this would have happened without our goddess Umi.
Thanks but I... really didn't do anything.
Come on, quit being so modest and say you're welcome.
I am certain Umi and Shun wish they could be here to thank you personally.
But urgent matters have taken them away.
Urgent matters eh. Ah, to be young.
Gen! Can you give us a ride?
Umi, don't you worry and hang on.
I'll get you there with time to spare.
If we're going to make it we'd better run!
Sorry I could get you there, Umi!
The kids are here to see you captain.
So when, you're my good friend Τachibana's boy.
And you must be Sawamura's daughter.
And that's him sitting in the front row, fourth from the right.
And sitting next to him is Sawamura.
We were just like brothers, the three of us.
Τachibana, you should take the seat of honor.
Because you're our fearless leader. You belong there.
If I'm your leader, we're in trouble.
Don't be the hero and die before me, ok.
They were the best friend's a man ever had. I think about them every day.
They were brave and honest and I am honored to have known them.
When I look at you, what I see is the legacy of those two great man.
And I know they would be very proud.
